posts.title: It’s Homecoming Week At The University Of Arkansas
posts.content:
Calling All Hogs Home is the theme of this year’s Homecoming at the U of A, bringing thousands of alumni home to the Hill to see the Razorbacks take on Liberty. 

  • A hundred homecomings: Founded on Mar 27, 1871, the University hosted its first-ever Homecoming parade on Nov 16, 1922, making this the 100th Year of Homecoming Tradition.
  • Peppy pig parade: The Homecoming Parade will make its way down Dickson St on Friday, Nov 4 at 6p followed by a Pep Rally in the Chi Omega Greek Theater at 7:30p. 

Find a calendar of this week’s Homecoming events HERE.

posts.title: Crystal Bridges Gala Draws Celebrities And Fashion Icons To Bentonville
posts.photoCredit: Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art
posts.content:
Crystal Bridges welcomed celebrities and fashion legends to Bentonville last week during the Grit to Glamour gala, part of the museum's first-ever fashion exhibition. 

  • Best in the biz: A fashion symposium was held before the gala featuring conversations with fashion icons like Tommy Hilfiger, Tracy Reese, Aurora James, Bethann Hardison, and more. 
  • Sparkling debate: Other celebrities attended like Norman Lear, Seth Meyers, and Karlie Kloss, whose Instagram post of her very sparkly dress sparkled so hard it sparked the age-old debate of whether NWA is in the South or the Midwest. 

Learn more about the Fashioning America: Grit to Glamour exhibition HERE.

posts.title: Ozark Compost Wants To Smash Your Pumpkins
posts.content:
Over 1.3b pounds of pumpkins end up in landfills every year unable to properly decompose, so Ozark Compost is offering three opportunities to give your pumpkins a more environmentally friendly farewell. 

  • Smash sites: Say a proper peace out to your pumpkins on Nov 5 from 12-3p at Pack Rat in Fayetteville, on Nov 6 from 1-3p at Bentonville Brewing Co, or Nov 9 from 6-8p at Ozark Beer Co in Rogers. 
  • Pumpkin perks: Drop off your pumpkins at one of the locations and you can sign up for a free one-month trial of Ozark Compost & Swap. 

Follow Ozark Compost on Instagram for more info HERE.

posts.title: Business And Industry Training Closing The Skills Gap In NWA
posts.content:
Formed in 1996, Business and Industry Training provides NWA workers with business and industrial maintenance training necessary for skilled jobs. 

  • Equipped for success: BIT has become the go-to training organization for many local businesses and public schools for industrial, safety, and computer skills training. 
  • Closing the gap: With accessible training offered at BITs Gentry and Springdale locations, students can complete courses in 5-6 weeks for as little as $900 per course. 

Read the Business & Politics feature on Business and Industry Training HERE.

posts.title: Treehouse Pantry In Springdale Celebrates First Anniversary
posts.content:
Treehouse Pantry has been serving families of students in Springdale Schools for a full year, and that's something worth celebrating!

  • Packing on pounds: During its first year, the pantry served nearly 8,500 families, provided 50,000 student snack packs, and distributed nearly 1m pounds of perishable and non-perishable food items. 
  • Party time: To celebrate one year of serving the community, Treehouse Pantry will host a drop-in event on Nov 1 from 1-3p. Stop by to say congrats on one year!

Follow Springdale Schools for updates on Treehouse Pantry HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Pass the mic: Nothing brings people together quite like music and amateur singing. So why not book a holiday party for your office, family, or friends at Big Box Karaoke?*
  • Good folks: The 75th annual Ozark Folk Festival returns to Eureka Springs on Nov 10 for three days of amazing folk music in one of the Ozarks' coolest small towns.*
  • Purple reign: The Fayetteville Volleydogs are state champs for the third year in a row, earning the program’s 7th state title for volleyball. 
  • The great outdoors: Hobbs State Park is hosting a great lineup of events this fall including Fall Leaf Hikes, learning to identify venomous snakes, and eagle-watching tours! 
  • Let's talk: Interested in advertising in the newsletter? Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
